summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding a new alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is willing to travel to New York for a victim meeting with the FBI on October 23, 2019. The emails discuss logistics for a conference call and the victim's travel arrangements.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: High-profile attorney who has a new client alleging victimization by Jeffrey Epstein; she is coordinating with federal prosecutors and the FBI to arrange the client's participation in a victim meeting.

persons.name: Daniel
persons.context: Attorney from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office who will be joining the scheduled conference call regarding the new alleged victim.

persons.name: Marianne Wang
persons.context: Attorney whose office is involved in the case; her associate Daniel is joining the call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; the new client is alleged to be a victim of Epstein.

connections.description: Allred is representing a client who alleges being a victim of Epstein, placing her in an adversarial legal relationship with Epstein's interests.
Allred is coordinating a conference call with Daniel, who is from co-counsel Marianne Wang's office, indicating a collaborative legal effort.
Allred is working with Marianne Wang's office as co-counsel on the case involving an Epstein victim.

events.title: FBI Victim Meeting in New York
events.description: A victim meeting organized by the FBI in New York where alleged victims of Jeffrey Epstein were to provide information; Gloria Allred's new client was willing to fly in to attend.

events.title: Scheduled Conference Call
events.description: A conference call scheduled for the afternoon of October 22, 2019, to discuss logistics for the new alleged victim's participation in the FBI meeting.

locations: Los Angeles, CA (6300 Wilshire Blvd., Suite 1500)
St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, had a new client in October 2019 who alleged being a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The client was willing to fly to New York to attend an FBI-organized victim meeting scheduled for October 23, 2019.
The FBI's victim services team was handling travel logistics for victims attending the meeting.
The email chain shows coordination between a victim's attorney and federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York regarding an active investigation into Epstein.
